data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward you take 10 steps forward. If you always face right you take 10 steps forward. If you always take backward you take 10 steps backward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It is implied in the other instructions that you should take the 4 steps to turn around and turn left. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Taking 6 steps gives you an idea of how far you are going. If you turn you are at 1st and back. If you turn around your back takes 2 steps so you are back in first. If you take 4 steps then your back is 6 and yours is 4. If you take 4 steps and you get back 6 you are 6 -8 and you are back -6 -8. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can return to the starting point by turning right and taking the first step. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn left and turn right (again). Take 9 steps to the right and take 3 steps to the left. Turn around and take 5 steps. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right after turning left. Turn around and go right if you get the hang of it. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you follow the instructions and take 8 steps, you begin the same walk in the direction you turned. If you follow the instructions again and take 8 steps, you complete the previous sequence and return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

As long as you keep going left without turning it takes 6 steps to get there. If you keep going right, you take 8 steps in order to get back there. If you keep going around, you take 4 steps to get there. If you keep going left, you take 4 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Always facing forward will always get you where you’ re going. No one should ever take more than one step forward. The answer: no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You cannot go back to your starting point once you return to it. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

One must always put the focus in the forward-facing direction for a sequence of steps to be effective. The sequence starts with f in the forward direction. The last instruction is to always face forward before taking one step backward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
When facing away from something it is best if you always face forward.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 3 steps left. Move your torso to face to the left. Take 3 steps left. Repeat for the remaining steps. Take 3 steps right. Move your torso to the right.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Let’s think by step: Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Face forward always. Always take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. A person does not always move in either direction. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right 1 time. Take 1 step. Take 1 step. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. So, the answer is No.

You turn around and take 10 steps. You can't walk backwards once you turn. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you follow the 7 Steps back to the starting point, you return to 7 Steps back. If you follow the 9 Steps back to the starting point, you return to 9 steps back. To go back to the starting point, you would need to take 11 Steps back. So, the answer is Yes.

You cannot turn around and back at the same point simultaneously. The answer: No.

To return to the starting point, your first step is the first one to go right. So, the answer is No.

Turning right is a direction the first step should be taken in. Thus, the answer is No.

There are multiple ways of turning around and then taking 10 steps. Walking down 4 steps to return to starting point is 3 steps. The answer: Yes.

In the first question, you took 7 steps in order to turn around. If you return to the original starting point, this would mean you took 10 steps. In the second question, you took 7 steps in order to turn around. So, the answer is Yes.

The instructions say to always face forward. Each direction has different numbers of steps. If you don’ t face forward, you take 7 steps left. 5 steps backward is a different sound. Therefore, the answer is no.

A person facing either right or left takes the first step. When someone faces backward, they take 7 steps backward. When someone faces left, they take 9 steps left. Thus, the answer is Yes.

Turn around means to turn around around and back again and take 4 steps back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

After facing forward, the opposite direction should go left. Then the opposite direction should be taken 6 steps right. So, the answer is Yes.

Right is the correct direction for turning around. It gives you an upside down direction to turn around on. So, the answer is No.

When you are "facing forward," your first step is to face forward. When you step backward, you are "facing backward." If you are always facing forward, you must take 2 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

In the first step, you take a straight path. In the next step, you take a hill. So, the answer is no.

Take 9 steps and turn around.

When facing forward and backward, one should always be facing forward. If you are facing backward, take 3 steps left, then take 8 steps backward. If you are facing right, take 3 steps left, then take 10 steps right. If you are facing forward, take 10 steps right and 3 steps left. So, the answer is No.

If you follow the instructions, you always face forward. If you follow the instructions, you always face backward. So, the answer is No.

Keep your eyes towards you and face forward. Always take 2 steps backward so that you are facing forward. If you repeat the four steps, 8 different times, you get back to the starting point. If you repeat the 5 steps, 8 different times, you get back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

The instructions in the beginning take 10 steps back. Then you'll turn on the right. The start-point is opposite from the start-point. So, the answer is No.

Face forward at all times. Take 7 steps left – this sets you up for that last step. Take 8 steps right – you aren’t facing forward. Take 10 steps backward – you are going to return to the starting point. If the instructions are correct you return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions: 5 steps left = 1 step left. 5 steps right = 2 steps right. If you follow these instructions: 5 steps right = 1 step left. 7 steps left = 9 steps left. 5 steps right = 1 step left. 8 steps right = 2 steps right. So, the answer is No.

Take 1 step forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 1 step left. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

. If you always face forward, you are facing forward.. Any number of steps backward is forward.. If you always face forward, you are facing in the right.. If you always face forward, you are facing in the left.. Taking 7 steps backward is the same as taking 1 step forward.. Moving left and right results in moving in the opposite direction.. If you always face forward, you are moving in the right.. If you always face forward, you are moving in the left.. If you always face forward, you are moving in the right.. If you always face forward, you are moving in the right.. If you always face forward, you are moving in the left.. If you always face forward, you are moving in the left.. Then, the number of steps to move in the right direction remains equal to the number that you step in the right direction.. The number of steps taken right is the same as the number that you took left.. The number of steps taken left is the same as the number that you took right..
